title: Court puts reinstatement of cannabis commission head on hold
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Judge rules fired Cannabis Control Commission Chair Shannon O’Brien must be reinstated, but state appeals to delay reinstatement.
O'Brien was removed by State Treasurer Deborah Goldberg in 2024 for alleged misconduct. Judge called the decision a 'house of cards.'
The state has spent over $970,000 in legal fees related to O'Brien's case. Her term is set to expire in August 2027.

title: Man charged with murder after woman, 38, found dead in Lynn, DA says
author: Audrey Cooney
bullets: Police found a 38-year-old woman dead in Lynn early Sunday morning on Newhall Street.
A 30-year-old Lynn man has been arrested and charged with her murder, according to the Essex County DA.
The suspect is scheduled for arraignment Monday morning in Lynn District Court; names have not been released.

title: Jakobi Meyers shuts down questions about trade request: ‘Happy to be a Raider’
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Jakobi Meyers expressed contentment with remaining a Raider despite requesting a trade due to contract negotiation issues.
Meyers had eight catches for 97 yards in the Raiders' 20-13 win against the Patriots at Gillette Stadium.
The Raiders made offseason changes, including new head coach Pete Carroll and quarterback Geno Smith, after a tough 2024 season.

title: Tornado confirmed in Mass. town as powerful storm sweeps over region
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: A radar-confirmed tornado touched down near Worcester, Massachusetts, specifically in Holden, during Saturday's storm, per NWS updates.
The storm system placed the East Coast from Baltimore to Maine under severe weather watches, impacting much of Massachusetts.
Paxton and Holyoke reported fallen electrical lines and road blockages, but no injuries were recorded during the weather event.

title: In a season promising change, the 2025 Patriots looked all too familiar in season opener
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: The New England Patriots lost their season opener 20-13 to the Las Vegas Raiders at Gillette Stadium.
Quarterback Drake Maye completed 14 of 20 passes in the first half but struggled in the second with a key interception.
Despite improvements in defense, the Patriots allowed nine plays of over 20 yards, highlighting ongoing defensive issues.

title: Will Campbell’s NFL debut was solid until things began to unravel late in the second half
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Will Campbell, Patriots rookie left tackle, started strong in NFL debut but faltered in the second half against the Raiders.
Campbell was responsible for two sacks and two false start penalties, impacting Patriots' late comeback attempts.
Raiders' Maxx Crosby praised Campbell's potential despite struggles, noting his talent and the coaching under Josh McDaniels.

title: Lynn police officer on leave after becoming ‘suddenly incapacitated’ while on duty
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: A Lynn police officer was placed on leave after appearing incapacitated during a traffic stop, prompting an investigation.
Video shows the unnamed officer blinking slowly and struggling to stand, while bystanders accuse him of substance misuse.
Lynn Police attribute the incident to a medical episode and are examining all contributing factors according to their statement.

title: Patriots stock watch: Here’s who stood out and struggled against the Raiders
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Patriots lose 20-13 to Raiders in Mike Vrabel's debut as head coach at Gillette Stadium.
Harold Landry III excelled with 2.5 sacks, contributing significantly despite the team's overall defensive struggles.
The Patriots' running game faltered, totaling only 60 yards, with Rhamondre Stevenson averaging 2.1 yards per carry.

title: Review & setlist: Dropkick Murphys come on strong, avert disaster at soggy Suffolk Downs
author: Marc Hirsh
bullets: Dropkick Murphys headlined the Seisiún festival at Suffolk Downs despite rain delays and poor weather conditions.
A thunderstorm forced a two-hour delay, causing an evacuation before music resumed late in the evening.
The band performed passionately with songs like 'The Boys Are Back', 'Rose Tattoo', and a tribute to Shane McGowan.

title: Bill Belichick explains ‘simple’ reason why he decided to ban Patriots scout at UNC
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Bill Belichick banned a Patriots scout from UNC practices over a perceived lack of hospitality toward him.
Former Patriots coach Belichick cited his unwelcome status at the Patriots as the reason for the ban.
Patriots head coach Mike Vrabel said the team will find other ways to scout UNC players despite the ban.
